summary: Implements the core single-page Valentine flow (choice card -> dialogs) with pink-themed styling, animations, and decorative assets referenced from /assets/generated. However, required generated image files are not shown as added, the exact Valentine message text requirement is not met due to wording differences, and authentication/Internet Identity wiring was introduced despite being a non-goal/constraint.

missing_requirements.requirement: When the user selects "pookie", show a sweet Valentine message containing the following sentiment in English: "you're the most amazing person in my life, seeing you makes me smile and you're highlight of my day, you're special, love you."
missing_requirements.reason: The implemented message is split into multiple sentences with different capitalization and wording; specifically it uses "you're the highlight of my day" instead of the requested "you're highlight of my day" and does not present the sentiment as the provided text.

missing_requirements.requirement: Include required generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated with the requested filenames and use them in the UI.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references the generated image paths, but the diff summary does not show the actual image files being added under frontend/public/assets/generated, so their presence at the specified paths is not evidenced.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity / authentication provider and identity-aware actor logic added to the frontend.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly lists authentication/user accounts as a non-goal and also states immutable frontend hook paths must not be modified; the diff adds/uses Internet Identity provider and related hooks anyway.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend actor file added (empty Motoko actor).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest states the feature should be implementable without backend changes; adding a backend actor file is not requested for this purely-frontend interaction.
